profitMissing.title: How much profit are we missing?

section1.title: WESTERN HOTELS. HOW MUCH PROFIT DO WE LOSE EACH YEAR?
section1.point1: Collectively, about $75 billion is lost each year
section1.point2: It's not sold: it's pure profit, before taxes
section1.point3: Our average annual occupancy rate is 60%
section1.point4: That only allows us to cover costs and have little income
section1.point5: But we don't capture the real profit: the remaining 40% of empty rooms. Our pure gain

section2.title: AND HOW MUCH PROFIT DOES YOUR HOTEL LOSE EACH YEAR?
section2.point1: Just five empty rooms per day = about $55,000 lost annually
section2.point2: 20 empty rooms per day = about $220,000 in pure profit
section2.point3: A 200-room hotel closed from October to May loses $1 million and also accumulates $420,000 in losses
section2.point4: And one with 500 rooms? More than $3 million in lost profit each year. And the losses... better not look at them

section3.title: YES. THE VAST MAJORITY OF HOTELS LOSE THEIR TRUE PROFIT POTENTIAL
section3.point1: Empty rooms are our untapped gold
section3.point2: Few of us achieve 100% occupancy all year round
section3.point3: It doesn't matter if we're 3 or 5 stars: we all lose money
section3.point5: We are giving up our rightful place in society
